keyword: how many calories are in a pound of hamburger
title: How Many Calories Are in a Pound of Hamburger?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a pound of hamburger, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Pound of Hamburger?
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef (hamburger meat), cooked (pan-broiled), drained; 1 pound = 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, fat drainage, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pound of cooked 80/20 hamburger provides ~1117 kcal and ~109 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil per 100 g during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories are in a pound of raw hamburger?
faqs.a: About 931 kcal for 1 pound raw 80/20 ground beef, as cooking reduces weight and fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in a pound of hamburger?
faqs.a: Approximately 109 g protein in 1 pound cooked 80/20 hamburger.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in hamburger?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”90% lean has ~176 kcal per 100 g (vs. 246 for 80%), lowering totals significantly.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a pound of cooked hamburger?
faqs.a: Around 76 g total fat, including 29 g saturated, for 80/20 cooked and drained.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in hamburger meat?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain ground beef hamburger.
